newsitem.title: USA: Sybase Q1 net profit vs loss.
newsitem.headline: Sybase Q1 net profit vs loss.

text.p: Sybase Inc on Thursday reported a better-than-expected first-quarter profit, reversing a loss from last year, on lower costs and new customers for its database software.
Sybase, a database software developer, said it had net income of $3.5 million, or $0.05 a share, compared with a loss of $6.9 million, or $0.09 a share, in the same quarter a year ago.
First-quarter revenue fell to $241.9 million from $243.7 million a year ago.
Wall Street analysts expected Sybase, based in Emeryville, Calif., to earn a penny a share in the first quarter, according to a recent analyst survey by Zacks Investment Research.
